page.title: 12OLD HOUSES BRAISHFIELD AREA
page.content: There are in the area of Sharpes Farm some C16/17 houses, timber-framed with hipped thatched roofs. The Granary at the farm has an old tiled roof and is on staddle stones.Laurel Cottage,once the Smithy,has a timber frame with some herring-bone brick infilling.Part of Red Cottage is reputed to be 400yrs old.Paynes Hay farmhouse to the North is C17/18,has a hipped tiled roof and a massive chimney.To the East,near Pucknall Farm,a house converted from two old cottages,has an old tiled roof and interior beams. Further East Slackstead Manor has flat eaves and old tiled roof.To the South, Ampfield House is an C18 elegant Georgian house,now the administrative H.Q.of Hilliers Nurseries. For futher information,see Hampshire Treasures Vols.1 & 9 published by Hampshire County Council.
